questions.title: Company name
questions.description: How would you know which entry is form which company?

questions.title: What will be my responsibilities?
questions.description: What will I do? Do I need to communicate with a client? Do I need to attend meetings?

questions.title: Who will I report to?
questions.description: My manager? Project manager? Scrum master? Senior colleague? Nobody?

questions.title: What are your expectations of me?
What are the biggest challenges your team is currently facing?
questions.description: Technological challenges, personal, any type of challenge and how they handle it.

questions.title: How do customers benefit from your product?
questions.description: Show that you care about customers and quality of end product

questions.title: What technologies are you using and why?
questions.description: Who has chosen the specific technology? Why? And how are they satisfied with it?

questions.title: Do you use automatic code formatter?
questions.label: Yes, we automatic code formatter.

questions.title: How you decided on code style rules?
How is code style enforced?
questions.description: When is the linter / formatter run? Is it automatic?

questions.title: Do you do code reviews?
questions.label: Yes, we do code review.

questions.title: Do you use automated tests?
questions.label: Yes, we use automated tests.

questions.title: Do you use CI/CD pipeline?
questions.label: Yes, we use CI/CD pipeline.

questions.title: How are interfaces between services documented?
What architecture do you use for this project and why?
How much of the project is documented? (estimate)
How much of the project is covered by automated tests? (estimate)
questions.description: Unit tests, integration tests, UI tests. Any kind of test.

questions.title: What type of tests do you use?
How big are teams?
How are teams structured? Do you have senior developers in every team?
How is the team work schedule?
questions.description: Are members flexible? Do they have fixed time meetings? Fixed work hours? Are they able to communicate asynchronously?

questions.title: Is every task documented in Issue Tracker before implementation is started?
questions.label: Yes, we document tasks first.

questions.title: Do you use JIRA / Trello / Kanban board?
questions.label: Yes, we use JIRA / Trello / Kanban board.

questions.title: How are projects managed? Do you use any specific methodologies?
Who communicates with a client?
questions.description: Is this also a responsibility of developer?

questions.title: How often do you talk to client?
Who decides when the project is done? What about technical debt?
questions.description: The functionality might be implemented but in a hacky way? What happens next?

questions.title: How are tasks prioritized & who prioritizes them?
questions.description: Also ask about technical tasks? Technical debt again?

questions.title: How are tasks estimated & who estimates them?
What happens when estimated turns out to be incorrect?
questions.description: How did you handle such situations in past? How do you communicated it to client?

questions.title: How and who determines that the task is done and workign correctly?
How do you release code to production?
questions.description: Is it automatic? How often? How do we know that the software has no bugs?

questions.title: Where are applications deployed?
Who manages deployments and provides operations support?
How do you retrieve logs from production?
questions.description: Do you? Why not? What if you had to due to a bug in production?

questions.title: Do you use exception trackers?
questions.description: Have it ever helped in fixing the bug in production? Why not?

questions.title: Feedback for me
